From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

brillar (first-person singular indicative present brillo, past participle brilláu)

  1. (intransitive) to shine (to emit light)
    Synonym: llucir

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of brillar
infinitive brillar
gerund brillando
past participle m brilláu, f brillada, n brillao, m pl brillaos, f pl brillaes

preterite brillé brillasti, brillesti brilló brillemos brillastis, brillestis brillaron
pluperfect brillare, brillara brillares, brillaras brillare, brillara brilláremos, brilláramos brillareis, brillarais brillaren, brillaran
future brillaré brillarás brillará brillaremos brillaréis brillarán
conditional brillaría brillaríes brillaría brillaríemos, brillaríamos brillaríeis, brillaríais brillaríen

Related terms

[edit]
  • brillante
  • brillu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “brillar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “brillar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [bɾiˈʎa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [bɾiˈʎaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Etymology 1

[edit]

Borrowed from Italian brillare.

Verb

[edit]

brillar (first-person singular present brillo, first-person singular preterite brillí, past participle brillat)

  1. to shine
Derived terms
[edit]
  • brillant

Etymology 2

[edit]

From earlier brellar. Likely borrowed from Old Occitan brailar (“to sing [said of birds]”).

Verb

[edit]

brillar (first-person singular present brillo, first-person singular preterite brillí, past participle brillat)

  1. to imitate the call of a bird
Derived terms
[edit]
  • brill

Further reading

[edit]
  • “brillar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “brellar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Interlingua

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

brillar

  1. to shine

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of brillar

conditional brillarea haberea brillate
imperative brilla —

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Italian brillare.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • IPA(key): /bɾiˈʝaɾ/ [bɾiˈʝaɾ]
  • IPA(key): /bɾiˈʝaɾ/ [bɾiˈʝaɾ] (most of Spain and Latin America)
  • IPA(key): /bɾiˈʎaɾ/ [bɾiˈʎaɾ] (rural northern Spain, Andes Mountains, Paraguay, Philippines)
  • IPA(key): /bɾiˈʃaɾ/ [bɾiˈʃaɾ] (Buenos Aires and environs)
  • IPA(key): /bɾiˈʒaɾ/ [bɾiˈʒaɾ] (elsewhere in Argentina and Uruguay)

  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: bri‧llar

Verb

[edit]

brillar (first-person singular present brillo, first-person singular preterite brillé, past participle brillado)

  1. to shine
    Synonyms: relucir, resplandecer
  2. to glow
  3. to sparkle, glisten, glitter, twinkle

Conjugation

[edit]

2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
